sentences.english: Neutered cats are thought to be at particular risk of obesity.
sentences.chinese: 閹割後的貓被認爲特別容易出現肥胖現象。

sentences.english: He was given experimental chemical castration as a "treatment".
sentences.chinese: 當時處於實驗中的化學閹割作爲對他的“治療”。

sentences.english: Being un-castrated is one of the highest risk factors for mortality in free-roaming cats.
sentences.chinese: 不閹割，是散養或流浪貓死亡的高危因素。

sentences.english: Philip, you see that sexually altered, racially different person?
sentences.chinese: 你看見那個和你不同種族，被閹割的人了嗎？

sentences.english: But that doesn't mean Google will neuter itself to please the government.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這並不意味着谷歌要閹割自己以取悅政府。

sentences.english: The applause disguised his grief and humiliation over the loss and ' castrating ' rejection.
sentences.chinese: 掌聲掩蓋了他對喪失和“閹割性”拒絕的悲傷和羞辱。

sentences.english: His splayed hand pulled at his crotch as if emasculation would be sweet to him.
sentences.chinese: 他張開雙手拉住胯下，彷彿閹割也是一種享受。

sentences.english: No one who has been emasculated by crushing or cutting may enter the assembly of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 凡外腎受傷的，或被閹割的，不可入耶和華的會。
我們所稱的閹割是什麼呢？

sentences.english: The next phase imposes neutering on cats from breeders and sellers.
sentences.chinese: 階段要對餵養的貓和販賣的貓閹割手術。

sentences.english: Spayed females will shed the same as males.
sentences.chinese: 閹割的雌性脫毛的週期和雄性一樣。

sentences.english: You might see it as another example emasculation.
sentences.chinese: 你也許又覺得我在“閹割”他了。

sentences.english: Arlen and colleagues enrolled 42 patients who had castration-resistant prostate cancer.
sentences.chinese: 阿倫和他的同事參加42例誰閹割了抗前列腺癌。

sentences.english: The next phase imposes neutering on cats from breeders and sellers.
sentences.chinese: 第二階段要對餵養的貓和販賣的貓進行閹割手術。

sentences.english: It's really important to spay or neuter your pets.
sentences.chinese: 爲你的寵物實施切除卵巢或閹割手術非常重要。

sentences.english: My goal was to try to persuade my classmates to neuter their pets.
sentences.chinese: 我的目標是說服我的同學閹割他們的寵物。

definition: to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to abridge/to cut a text down to size for publication
an execution/to put sb to death
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
